Stem: Erect, with wings up to 1.5 cm wide, and spines to 5 mm long. Wooly or cobwebby appearance.
Leaves: Grey-green, spiny, egg shaped to lance shaped, up to 35 cm long.
Flowers: White to purple heads up to 6 cm diameter.
FruitSeeds: Brown-grey 4-5 mm long, ribbed with hairs on top.
Habitat: Pastures, irrigated and dryland cropping areas.
DistinguishingFeatures: Similar to other Onopordum species, but with a stem unlike Stemless thistle, and with deeper lobed leaves and more wooly stems than Illyrian thistle.
